titles.title: Digimon Xros Wars: Toki o Kakeru Shounen Hunter-tachi
Digimon Xros Wars: The Boy Hunters Who Leapt Through Time
Digimon Fusion II
جنگ های صلیبی دیجیمون : شکارچیان جوانی که در زمان پریدند
Digimon Xros Wars III
digixw3
digimon8
デジモンクロスウォーズ 時を駆ける少年ハンターたち
Digimon Xros Wars: The Young Hunters Who Leapt Through Time
数码兽合体战争 穿越时空的少年猎人们
توکی او کاکرو شونن هانتر تاچی

relatedanime.anime: Digimon Xros Wars: Aku no Death General to Nanatsu no Oukoku

recommendations.recommendation:
Get ready fans of digimon!!!!! A new action-packed digimon series is here!!!!!!
Join Taigiru, Gumdramon, Yuu, Damemon, Taiki, Shoutmon, and friends on a super epic awesome adventure to save the digital world!!!!!!

anime.description: The battle in the Digital World ended in victory for the Digimon and humans who joined forces and fought together. One year after that battle... Tagiru Akashi, a member of the Xros Heart street basketball team, has set his sights on surpassing his respected senior, Taiki Kudou, and his classmate, Yuu Amano, to become the team`s top star. But then, in the midst of these peaceful days, a mysterious boy and his companions appear before Taiki. In warning, the boy tells Taiki, "Don`t try to get involved in what`s about to happen in this town," and disappears... Clueless to what`s going on in the town, Tagiru visits an arcade. There he experiences a strange sensation, as though the flow of time around him is thrown off kilter. Then he senses an unknown presence lurking around the area... Tagiru hears the voice of someone who seems to be injured and follows it through a distorted space in the air, finding himself in a world called "DigiQuartz," where time progresses differently from that of the real world. In DigiQuartz, Tagiru watches as a team of two boys and a girl hunt a monster they call a Digimon. This is the very trio that had appeared before Taiki with the warning to steer clear - Ryouma, Ren, and Airu. Tagiru then meets Gumdramon, the owner of the voice that had spoken to him in the arcade, and saves him from being hunted by Ryouma and his companions. Tagiru instantly befriends Gumdramon and they decide to join the Digimon Hunt together. Then Tagiru visits a watchmaker`s shop on the outskirts of town, where the mysterious old Watchmaker, rumored among many Digimon Hunters, gives him a Xros Loader. Returning to DigiQuartz, Tagiru then encounters MetalTyrannomon. He immediately attempts a Digimon Hunt, but he and Gumdramon are soon backed into a tight spot by MetalTyrannomon`s counterattack. Just then the Xros Loader begins to glow, and Gumdramon Digivolves into Arresterdramon! With his greatly heightened power, he defeats MetalTyrannomon, ending Tagiru`s first Digimon Hunt in success. Thus the Hunter boys Taiki, Tagiru, and Yuu begin a brand new adventure as they go on to Hunt the Digimon that appear in the human world!

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: fictional location
tag.description: A fictional location is a place or world which is run by different set of rules than our common and ordinary world. This may include completely fictional worlds with no semblance of Earth, computer-generated worlds, fantasy worlds, magical worlds, parallel worlds accessible through portals, and so on. Or it may be fictional places like floating islands, dungeons or planets, which can co-exist with ordinary Earth, but are otherwise separate from it. A world that generally shares the characteristics of, and/or is generally indistinguishable from the real world (bar research on a "more than cursory" level), would NOT be considered a fictional world. A good example is http://anidb.net/a4521 [Code Geass]. It contains several real world nationalities, such as http://anidb.net/a4521 [China], http://anidb.net/t2672 [Japan] (now Area 11), http://anidb.net/t5091 [India], etc, along with fictional nationalities such as http://anidb.net/t2361 [Britannia]. China, Japan, and India are easily identified with a cursory look. The location is unmistakably the planet Earth, even though national borders have been redrawn. The fictional world should only be tagged if it plays a materially important role in the plot and setting; generally, an episodic occurrence of a fictional world should not be tagged. A fantasy world is a type of fictional world, part of a fictional universe. Typical worlds involve, but are not limited to: magic or magical abilities, and/or a medieval theme. Some examples include: a parallel world tenuously connected to Earth via magical portals or items; a fictional Earth-like planet in the remote past or future; or an entirely independent world set in another universe. Many fantasy worlds draw heavily on real world history, geography, and sociology, and also on folklore.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: proxy battles
tag.description: In our terms, a proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode. Often the training aspect is also involved, or in some cases the proxies are nothing more than holographic representatives of some other variation of competition (like for example a card game). While many popular shounen anime fit under this category, it`s not limited to shounen anime.

tag.name: male protagonist
tag.description: This anime has a male protagonist.

tag.name: mythology
tag.description: The anime gets inspirations from many forms of mythologies (either Greek, Egyptian, Nord, etc.) to form its story and setting.

tag.name: Greek mythology
tag.description: The anime is derived or draws elements from the Greek mythology, and as such features some mythological characteristics of Ancient Greece. Those may be creatures, such as the Centaur or Hydra, tales, such as that of the Trojan War, or even the Gods themselves, like Zeus or Poseidon. More subtle references also count, such as the careful usage of names of places or people that hold significance in the myths.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Amano Nene
character.description: Cute brown hair ponytail girl. Her partner was Solarmon.

episode.title: おれたち, デジモンハンター!
We Are Digimon Hunters!
Oretachi, Digimon Hunter!
episode.summary: The new chapter in the Digimon Xros Wars series, Time Traveling Hunter Boys, finally begins! The story takes place one year after the battle with the Death Generals. Taiki has started a basketball team, Xros Heart, with his school underclassmen Yuu and Tagiru. Life has been peaceful. Then, one day, the air before Taiki flickers and a monstrous shadow flashes before his eyes. He then meets three mysterious characters - Ryouma, Ren, and Airu - who tell him "This town may become a bit chaotic. Our own game is about to begin." What could these words mean...?! The next day, Tagiru hears the voice of a Digimon on the verge of death, Gumdramon. This leads him to DigiQuartz, a game world inhabited by Digimon. Fascinated by a Digimon Hunt he witnesses there, Tagiru teams up with Gumdramon and starts on his way to becoming a Digimon Hunter! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 生徒たちが消えた! ゆらめくサゴモンの影
Students Are Disappearing! The Wavering Shadow of Sagomon
Seito-tachi ga Kieta! Yurameku Sagomon no Kage
episode.summary: Students from Tagiru`s school are disappearing one after another! Meanwhile, Tagiru and Gumdramon have sensed something moving in the Digimon realm, DigiQuartz. Following its trail, they discover someone, or something, carrying a boy from Tagiru`s school... Tagiru rushes to follow him, but then he`s attacked by Sagomon, a Digimon that looks like a kappa! As even experienced Digimon Hunters call Sagomon a tough customer, Tagiru and Gumdramon are no match for his fierce attacks... Soon after, Tagiru confronts Sagomon again. He Digivolves Gumdramon in an attempt to capture Sagomon, but they are only pushed back further. When Taiki, who has been watching their struggle, declares "I can`t turn my back on them!", Shoutmon hears him and responds. After reloading from Taiki`s Xros Loader, Shoutmon Digivolves and gains further power through a DigiXros fusion. He then launches his attack on Sagomon! How will their battle end?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: デジモン剣道勝負! コテモンの刃が迫る!!
Digimon Kendo Match! The Blade of Kotemon Approaches!!
Digimon Kendou Shoubu! Kotemon no Yaiba ga Semaru!!
episode.summary: Ninth grader and master swordsman Musashi Kenzaki, who sees Taiki as his rival, begins to undergo kendo training with a Digimon named Kotemon. As this goes on, incidents of rampant test attacks begin to occur! Sensing that a Digimon might be involved, Tagiru sets out on a Digimon Hunt with Gumdramon. They then discover that Musashi is behind the test attacks. Musashi insists that he was fighting fair and square, that they were proper duels and not test attacks, but in the next moment he`s surrounded by a black aura...! Is it Kotemon`s doing, or is another Digimon behind this...?! Tagiru and company take a stand to find the truth behind Musashi`s black aura! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: かわいさ要注意! キュートハンター, アイルの罠!
Cuteness Caution! The Cute Hunter, Airu`s Trap!
Kawaisa Youchuui! Cute Hunter, Airu no Wana!
episode.summary: Yuu still hasn`t forgotten the pain caused by the loss of his Digimon partner, Damemon. When the Digimon Hunter Airu sees one of Yuu`s long-cherished Digimon, Cutemon, her heart is instantly taken! In order to steal Cutemon, she takes Yuu to the Digimon world, DigiQuartz, and traps him. Cutemon tries desperately to save him, but his strength is nowhere near enough... Tagiru and Gumdramon manage to save Yuu and Cutemon once, but of course, Airu has no intention of giving up! She continues to relentlessly pursue Cutemon. Eventually the Digimon Hunters Ryouma and Ren, along with Tagiru, Taiki, Shoutmon, and Dorulumon, also become involved in the heated conflict...! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 優等生が狙われた! ブロッサモンの微笑
Honor Students Are Targeted! Blossomon`s Smile
Yuutousei ga Nerawareta! Blossomon no Bishou
episode.summary: When Tagiru`s classmate Miho Sudo grows jealous of the school`s higher-ranked honor students, she ends up possessed by a Digimon! The next day something strange happens to the top two honor students, Mishima and Takahashi, in the middle of class. Their skin suddenly turns brown and they appear to wither, as if something is sucking the nutrients out of them. Sensing that this is a Digimon`s doing, Tagiru warps to the Digimon world, DigiQuartz. There he sees strange things that look like plant vines scattered throughout the school and wrapped around Mishima and Takahashi, as if to conceal them. Tagiru and Gumdramon attempt to find out just how far the vines reach. Just then the Digimon Hunter Ren appears and tells Tagiru that the vines themselves are a Digimon, and a very strong one that keeps its true form hidden. When Ren has his Digimon partner Dracmon bite through a vine, Miho, back in the real world, appears to feel intense pain. Then the Digimon that had wrapped itself completely around Miho and assimilated her body, Blossomon, appears! When Miho and Blossomon warp to DigiQuartz, a fierce battle with Tagiru and company begins!! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ロボット部の夢, ピノッキモンの誘惑
The Robot Club`s Dream, Pinocchimon`s Temptation
Robot-bu no Yume, Pinocchimon no Yuuwaku
episode.summary: An email from Pinocchimon appears on the computer used by the robot club at Tagiru`s school. Pinocchimon shows Tokio and the other club members a blueprint and some parts and asks them to help him build a robot, luring them to the Digimon world, DigiQuartz. From that day onward, Tokio and the other club members turn up absent from school. As requested by the teacher, Tagiru visits Tokio`s house accompanied by Taiki and Yuu. When he sees Tokio working on building a robot as if possessed, Tagiru grows suspicious and decides to observe his movements. Tagiru and the others then watch as Tokio opens an email and enters DigiQuartz through a portal that opens in his computer screen! They rush after him and find themselves in an industrial area in DigiQuartz. They call upon the strengths of their Digimon companions Gumdramon and Shoutmon to locate Tokio and resume the chase. When they follow Tokio into a factory, they find a nearly completely assembled GigaBreakdramon...?! Tagiru and the others try to bring Tokio back from DigiQuartz, but at that moment Pinocchimon appears and starts up GigaBreakdramon. A new battle begins - how will it end?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: お好み焼きパニック! パグモンだらけの街
Okonomiyaki Panic! A Town Full of Pagumon
Okonomiyaki Panic! Pagumon Darake no Machi
episode.summary: Tagiru is on the Hunt for a Digimon that loves the smell of okonomiyaki, called Pagumon. The next day a Digimon called Jagamon, who makes people eating potato chips float in the air and disappear, suddenly turns up. Tagiru reloads Gumdramon to Hunt Jagamon, but they fail because of Pagumon. This causes Tagiru and Gumdramon to argue, and Gumdramon enters the rival Hunter Ryouma`s Xros Loader! Tagiru and Gumdramon are thus separated. In the midst of all this, Tagiru watches as something strange happens to Pagumon after chowing down on an okonomiyaki... What will happen to Tagiru and Gumdramon`s friendship, and with Pagumon who has fallen into an unforeseen crisis?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: デジモンハント大繁盛! 商店街のスゴ腕ハンター!!
The Digimon Hunt is Booming! The Remarkable Shopping District Hunter!!
Digimon Hunt Daihanjou! Shotengai no Sugoude Hunter!
episode.summary: A great number of Digimon called Zenimon appear in the shopping district, hanging out near cash registers and messing up the machines. Tagiru tries to hunt a Zenimon, but his target is snatched from him by a boy named Hideaki Mashimo. Tagiru and company make an agreement with Hideaki, who is only involved in the Digimon Hunt to make money and has no interest in Digimon at all, to capture Digimon together. As this goes on, Tagiru encounters a Digimon called Ganemon! They learn that the Zenimon are Ganemon`s underlings, but something happened and they all escaped. Ganemon asks them to help him recapture the Zenimon, so Tagiru and the others team up with him! However, soon enough something changes in Ganemon, sending the shopping district into a panic?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 狙われたタイキ! 超セレブ・スターの雄たけび!
The Digimon Hunt Thrives! The Remarkable Shopping District Hunter!!
Nerawareta Taiki! Cho Serebu Suta no Otakebi!
episode.summary: Taiki meets his childhood friend Akari again, and the two of them find themselves attending a dinner buffet party at a luxury hotel. Tickets for this party are normally rare since the event is booked full all year round, but somehow Akari won the tickets from a supermarket giveaway. But, of course, Yuu is on the scene! It turns out the whole thing was a trap set by the super celebrity star Digimon, SuperStarmon, to catch the superstar Digimon Hunter, Taiki. When Taiki is taken to the Digimon world, DigiQuartz, Tagiru and the others set out to save him. How will their battle end...?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 香港上陸! 超美少女アイドルを守れ!!
Arrival in Hong Kong! Protect the Super Gorgeous Idol!!
Hong Kong Jouriku! Chou Bishounen Idol o Mamore!
episode.summary: After receiving an urgent call for help from Nene, who is working as a popular idol in Hong Kong, Tagiru and his friends head to Hong Kong. Nene says she`s been having problems for about a week with a stalker in a mask following her around. Worse yet, when the police pursued the masked stalker, he escaped to DigiQuartz, the Digimon world! Tagiru suddenly becomes intent on protecting Nene, but it turns out the masked stalker is a powerful foe who uses Harpymon, a Digimon with extraordinary flying ability, in his schemes! The strength of Nene`s Digimon, Sparrowmon, is essential to defeat Harpymon. Nene and Sparrowmon immediately join Tagiru and company as they all venture into battle together! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: タギルがふにゃふにゃ!?ガムドラモン大ピンチ!!
Tagiru Goes Limp?! Gumdramon`s in Trouble!!
Tagiru ga Funyafunya!? Gumdramon Dai Pinch!
episode.summary: A Digimon that steals humans` motivation shows up. The Digimon, called FlaWizarmon, steals Tagiru`s motivation, leaving him limp and drained of energy. He`s left so listless, he can`t even make Gumdramon Digivolve. Meanwhile, FlaWizarmon continues to steal more and more people`s motivation. Taiki and Yuu, along with Shoutmon and the other Digimon, attempt to defeat FlaWizarmon and return Tagiru to normal. However, after absorbing Tagiru`s motivation, FlaWizarmon keeps getting back up no matter how many times they knock him down...! What is the fate of Gumdramon, who`s caught in a major bind without his partner`s motivation...? Will Tagiru ever go back to being the super-motivated middle schooler he used to be?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 子どもだけの世界旅行! 夢のデジモントレイン
World Travel for Kids Only! The Digimon Dream Train
Kodomo Dake no Sekai Ryokou! Yume no Digimon Train
episode.summary: Tagiru`s classmate, Kiichi, has begun riding on the locomotive Digimon, Locomon, and traveling to other countries every night. Eventually Kiichi and the other kids who spend all their time traveling with him start coming to school with very sleepy faces. Kiichi also starts to look thin and haggard. Worried, Tagiru and his friends decide to stop Kiichi from going on his trips. They start to board Locomon, but just then something happens! Ren, riding on Pteranomon, captures Locomon. Kiichi is stunned to see Locomon taken away and pleads for his return. Tagiru and company take Kiichi along to follow Locomon. Kiichi tries to persuade Locomon to come back to him. Will they succeed in granting Kiichi`s wish and taking Locomon back from Ren?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: おいしい? まずい? デジモン・ラーメン勝負!
Delicious? Disgusting? The Digimon Ramen Face-off!
Oishii? Mazui? Digimon Ramen Shoubu!
episode.summary: Masaru is Tagiru`s classmate and the son of the owner of a ramen shop, Katsuji, which has seen a significant decline in customers recently. Determined to help his classmate, Tagiru vows to make Katsuji into the kind of ramen shop that customers will line up to get into. But just when he`s about to take action, Katsuji`s ramen changes dramatically and people start to form a long line to eat it. Lurking behind this change are the shadows of Digimon called Ogremon and Fugamon! Ogremon and Fugamon have opened a ramen shop in the Digimon world, DigiQuartz, but since business is poor, they approach Katsuji, Masaru`s father and the owner of the ramen shop Katsuji. They agree to cooperate using Ogremon and Fugamon`s superb noodles with Katsuji`s prized soup. Katsuji`s shop thrives as a result. However, at the same time, Katsuji`s kind temperament changes and he begins to yell at customers. Wanting his kind father back, Masaru decides to make his own ramen to open his father`s eyes. What will happen when Tagiru and company stand by his side in this ramen face-off?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 友だち欲しい? フェレスモン悪魔の約束
You Want Friends? Phelesmon, the Devil`s Promise
Tomodachi Hoshii? Phelesmon Akuma no Yakusoku
episode.summary: The Digimon Phelesmon, has promised to make the new kid Makoto popular. Phelesmon is hypnotizing the students and it’s causing him to grow stronger. With Tagiru and Taiki the only ones not hypnotized, are they strong enough to stop him?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ハンター大集合! 南の島のデジモン争奪戦!
The Great Gathering of Hunters! A Fierce Digimon Battle on a Southern Island!
Hunter Dai Shuugou! Minami no Shima no Digimon Soudatsusen!
episode.summary: Tagiru, Taiki, and Yuu are invited to an event on a certain island where the strongest and most experienced Digimon Hunters can Hunt a powerful Digimon. When the event starts, they enter the forests in search of the powerful Digimon that lurks there, Volcdramon. Taiki and the others try to Hunt him, but the intense heat he unleashes makes it a difficult battle. Then, someone who didn`t enter the event joins in! Who could he be?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 伝説のヒーロー大集結! デジモンオールスター決戦!!
The Great Gathering of Legendary Heroes! The Digimon All-Stars Showdown!!
Densetsu no Hero Daishuuketsu! Digimon All-Star Kessen!!
episode.summary: Legendary Digimon Heroes are assembling to battle against Quartzmon turning the human world digital. But one more hero is needed and Tagiru has to fight the other Hunters for the spot. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 今明かされる! デジモンハントの秘密!
Now Revealed! The Secret of the Digimon Hunt
Ima Akasareru! Digimon Hunt no Himitsu!
episode.summary: One morning Tagiru arrives at school only to find it transformed to DigiQuartz. He believes this to be the work of a Tsumemon he sees on the scene, but when he tries to catch it, it Digivolves to Keramon before his eyes. Ryouma appears and saves Tagiru, but Keramon escapes, transforming the town to DigiQuartz as it flees. Soon the whole town is transformed and its human residents gone. Finally Taiki calls Tagiru and Ryouma to a strategy meeting, where they puzzle over how a Digimon can Digivolve without a human partner, and how to save the humans who have been erased from the town... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 黄金昆虫! メタリフェクワガーモンの謎
The Golden Insect! The Mystery of MetallifeKuwagamon
Ougon Konchuu! MetallifeKuwagamon no Nazo
episode.summary: Tagiru and Hideaki follow rumors of a shining golden stag beetle in the mountains, launching a Hunt when they suspect Digimon involvement. Meanwhile, Tagiru`s insect-loving classmate, Kaneda, is convinced that Tagiru is only trying to capture the new stag beetle species for profit, and won`t let him out of his sight. He ends up in DigiQuartz with Tagiru and Hideaki as they search for the truth behind the shining golden stag beetle... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 夢の遊園地, デジモンランド!
The Theme Park of Dreams, DigimonLand!
Yume no Yuuenchi, Digimon Land!
episode.summary: When kids begin to disappear in large numbers, Taiki and Yuu suspect a Digimon`s involvement and set out to investigate. Tagiru then returns from a failed Digimon Hunt and meets Bakomon, a Digimon who has been inviting children to a theme park called DigimonLand. Tagiru and Gumdramon follow him there and find many other Digimon working hard to make children happy. They decide to put off their Hunt and join the fun, but the good times are cut short when Tagiru`s friends try out the special attraction and are not seen again... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: レアカードが消えた! 無敵のルークチェスモン
The Rare Cards Have Disappeared! The Invincible RookChessmon
Rare Card ga Kieta! Muteki no RookChessmon
episode.summary: Hiroya strives for the top ranking in the card game Sea Monster Cards, but he`s not faring well without any strong rare cards. Then he meets KnightChessmon, a Digimon who promises to grant his wish. Later, Tagiru and his friends hear rumors of kids being dragged to another world where their rare cards are stolen. Suspecting a Digimon`s involvement, they head to a card game tournament to find the truth... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 海底大冒険! 夢の財宝デジモンを探せ!
The Great Undersea Adventure! Find the Treasure Digimon of Dreams!
Kaitei Dai Bouken! Yume no Zaihou Digimon o Sagase!
episode.summary: Tagiru and company are enjoying a day of fishing at the beach when a Digimon Hunter, Mizuki, and her partner, Submarimon, appear. Mizuki, also a treasure hunter, tells them of a sunken treasure in a cave in DigiQuartz that she can`t reach because it`s guarded by an evil Digimon called Dagomon. She asks Tagiru and the others to Hunt Dagomon for her, so they follow her to the undersea cave, where they find much more than just Dagomon... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: UFO・恐竜大集合! 夢のエカキモン
The Great Gathering of UFOs and Dinosaurs! Ekakimon of Dreams
UFO Kyouryuu Daishuugou! Yume no Ekakimon
episode.summary: After being teased by his classmates about his drawings of UFOs and UMAs, Shouta meets the Digimon Ekakimon that has the ability to turn drawings to reality. With Shouta’s powerful imagination, the school is in danger of being overrun by fearsome monsters. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 似てる? 似てない? 変装怪盗ベツモン
Resemblance or None at All? The Thief in Disguise, Betsumon
Niteru? Nitenai? Hensou Kaitou Betsumon
episode.summary: When the thief and master of disguises, Betsumon, shows up, Tagiru wants to Hunt him, but Gumdramon is unwilling. Even Ryouma and the other rival Hunters have fallen victim to Betsumon`s tricks, so Tagiru and company team up with them to stop him. Encouraged by Taiki, Gumdramon at last faces Betsumon in battle and reveals that the two of them used to be partners - but Betsumon no longer remembers him. Can Gumdramon recover his lost friendship with Betsumon? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ドキドキ恐怖体験! 心霊ハンターが吠える!!
A Thrilling Horror Experience! The Spirit Hunter`s Shout!!
Dokidoki Kyoufu Taiken! Shinrei Hunter ga Hoeru!!
episode.summary: An old phone rings and voice on the other end is asking for help. Tagiru and Yuu go to check it out and run into the ghost hunter Kaoru. Is the disturbance caused by a Digimon or something from the other side? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 燃え上がれタギル! 栄光のデジモンハント!
Get Fired Up, Tagiru! The Digimon Hunt for All the Glory!
Moeagare Tagiru! Eikou no Digimon Hunt!
episode.summary: The truth is revealed and it is up to Tagiru and Arresterdramon to save the digital world and the real world. But will the power of Brave Snatcher be enough to stop Quartzmon? Source: crunchyroll
